etomica.lattice

Class IndexIteratorRectangular

  • java.lang.Object
    • etomica.lattice.IndexIteratorRectangular
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IndexIterator, IndexIteratorSizable, java.io.Serializable

    public class IndexIteratorRectangular
extends java.lang.Object
implements IndexIterator, IndexIteratorSizable, java.io.Serializable
    Iterates arrays of int, such that 0 <= a[0] <= size[0], 0 <= a[1] <= size[1], etc., thereby spanning a rectangular region. For example, if size = {3,2}, iteration would give these values and then expire:
    {0,0}
    {0,1}
    {1,0}
    {1,1}
    {2,0}
    {2,1}
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Constructs iterator that returns int arrays of length D.

    • Constructor Detail

      • IndexIteratorRectangular

        public IndexIteratorRectangular(int D)
        Constructs iterator that returns int arrays of length D. Default size is 1 for each dimension, so that only the iterate {0,0,..,0} is returned; setSize can be used to modify the range. Call to reset is required before beginning iteration, in any case.

    • Method Detail

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Puts iterator in a condition to begin iteration. First iterate is {0,...,0}
        Specified by:
        reset in interface IndexIterator

      • hasNext

        public boolean hasNext()
        Indicates whether all iterates have been returned since last call to reset().
        Specified by:
        hasNext in interface IndexIterator

      • next

        public int[] next()
        Returns the next iterate, or null if hasNext is false. The same array instance is returned with each call to this method; only its element values are modified in accordance with the design of the iteration. Elements of returned array may be modified and will not affect iteration.
        Specified by:
        next in interface IndexIterator

      • setSize

        public void setSize(int size)
        Sets range of all indexes to the given value Indices returned vary from 0 to size-1

      • setSize

        public void setSize(int[] size)
        Sets the individual ranges for the elements of the returned array. Each element index[k] iterates over values from 0 to size[k]-1.
        Specified by:
        setSize in interface IndexIteratorSizable

      • getD

        public int getD()
        Returns the length of the integer array that is returned as an iterate.
        Specified by:
        getD in interface IndexIterator

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        main method to test and demonstrate class.
